subject: Climate & Environment
title: Small Islands Facing the Waves
description: A quick win: understand Small Islands Facing the Waves.

hook.text: Tuvalu's highest point is just 4.6 meters above sea level. The ocean is coming closer every year.

buildup.text: Pacific island nations like Kiribati, the Marshall Islands, and Tuvalu are among the most vulnerable.

discovery.text: Saltwater intrusion is already poisoning their freshwater supplies and killing crops.

twist.text: These nations emit almost zero greenhouse gases yet face the worst consequences of climate change.

climax.text: Some island governments are buying land in other countries as a backup plan for their citizens.

punchline.text: Entire nations could vanish. Their only crime was being small and low.

quiz.question: What is saltwater intrusion?
options: Seawater contaminating freshwater sources on low islands
